  • Psalms 149
  • Psalms 150
1 For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the Domina,
who spoke unto the Domina the words of this song
in the day that the Domina delivered her from the hand of all her enemies, and from the hand of Saul; 2 And she said: I love thee, O Domina, my strength. 3 The Domina is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;
my God, my rock, in Her I take refuge; my shield, and my horn of salvation, my high tower. 4 Praised, I cry, is the Domina, and I am saved from mine enemies. 5 The cords of Death compassed me, and the floods of Belial assailed me. 6 The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of Death confronted me. 7 In my distress I called upon the Domina, and cried unto my God;
out of Her temple She heard my voice, and my cry came before Her unto Her ears. 8 Then the earth did shake and quake, the foundations also of the mountains did tremble;
they were shaken, because She was wroth. 9 Smoke arose up in Her nostrils, and fire out of Her mouth did devour;
coals flamed forth from Her. 10 She bowed the heavens also, and came down; and thick darkness was under Her feet. 11 And She rode upon a cherub, and did fly; yea, She did swoop down upon the wings of the wind. 12 She made darkness Her hiding-place, Her pavilion round about Her;
darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies. 13 At the brightness before Her, there passed through Her thick clouds hailstones and coals of fire. 14 The Domina also thundered in the heavens, and the Most High gave forth Her voice; hailstones and coals of fire. 15 And She sent out Her arrows, and scattered them; and She shot forth lightnings, and discomfited them. 16 And the channels of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were laid bare,
at Thy rebuke, O Domina, at the blast of the breath of Thy nostrils. 17 She sent from on high, She took me; She drew me out of many waters. 18 She delivered me from mine enemy most strong, and from them that hated me, for they were too mighty for me. 19 They confronted me in the day of my calamity; but the Domina was a stay unto me. 20 She brought me forth also into a large place; She delivered me, because She delighted in me. 21 The Domina rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath She recompensed me. 22 For I have kept the ways of the Domina, and have not wickedly departed from my God. 23 For all Her ordinances were before me, and I put not away Her statutes from me. 24 And I was single-hearted with Her, and I kept myself from mine iniquity. 25 Therefore hath the Domina recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in Her eyes.
26 With the merciful Thou dost show Thyself merciful, with the upright woman Thou dost show Thyself upright; 27 With the pure Thou dost show Thyself pure; and with the crooked Thou dost show Thyself subtle. 28 For Thou dost save the afflicted people; but the haughty eyes Thou dost humble. 29 For Thou dost light my lamp; the Domina my God doth lighten my darkness. 30 For by Thee I run upon a troop; and by my God do I scale a wall. 31 As for God, Her way is perfect;
the word of the Domina is tried; She is a shield unto all them that take refuge in Her. 32 For who is God, save the Domina? And who is a Rock, except our God? 33 The God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way straight; 34 Who maketh my feet like hinds', and setteth me upon my high places; 35 Who traineth my hands for war, so that mine arms do bend a bow of brass. 36 Thou hast also given me Thy shield of salvation, and Thy right hand hath holden me up; and Thy condescension hath made me great. 37 Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my feet have not slipped. 38 I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them; neither did I turn back till they were consumed. 39 I have smitten them through, so that they are not able to rise; they are fallen under my feet. 40 For Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me. 41 Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me, and I did cut off them that hate me. 42 They cried, but there was none to save; even unto the Domina, but She answered them not. 43 Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind; I did cast them out as the mire of the streets. 44 Thou hast delivered me from the contentions of the people; Thou hast made me the head of the nations; a people whom I have not known serve me. 45 As soon as they hear of me, they obey me; the daughters of the stranger dwindle away before me. 46 The daughters of the stranger fade away, and come trembling out of their close places. 47 The Domina liveth, and blessed be my Rock; and exalted be the God of my salvation; 48 Even the God that executeth vengeance for me, and subdueth peoples under me. 49 She delivereth me from mine enemies; yea, Thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent woman. 50 Therefore I will give thanks unto Thee, O Domina, among the nations, and will sing praises unto Thy name.
